- Asian Horror Cinema (ASIA 360D) examines the film-historical and socio-cultural contexts of horror films from the region. This course will discuss the recent Asian horror phenomenon, beginning with the success of the Ring franchise, as well as the origins of the genre within each national cinema. Throughout the semester we will explore how the horror genres ability to expose our subconscious fears and its capacity for allegory are employed to re-narrate national trauma and its impact on the individual.

courseName: Asian Horror Cinema: National Nightmares and Specters of Trauma
description: Engaging with the ideologies, industrial histories, socio-cultural contexts, and aesthetics of horror films - and the genre itself - from various Asian cinemas.
